Ingredients:
1. 1 tbsp coconut oil, 1 onion, 2 garlic cloves, thumb-sized piece ginger, 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste 2. 1 tbsp smooth peanut butter, 500g sweet potato, 400ml can coconut milk, 200g bag spinach 3. 1 lime juiced, cooked rice, to serve
Recipe:
1. Melt 1 tbsp coconut oil in a saucepan over a medium heat and soften 1 chopped onion for 5 mins 2. Add 2 grated garlic cloves and a grated thumb-sized piece of ginger, and cook for 1 min. Stir in 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste, 1 tbsp smooth peanut butter and 500g sweet potato. 3. Then add 400ml coconut milk and 200ml water. Bring to the boil, turn down the heat and simmer, uncovered, for 25-30 min. 4. Stir through 200g spinach and the juice of 1 lime, and season well. Serve with cooked rice.

Ingredients:
1. 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 onion, 4 garlic cloves, 250g chargrilled Mediterranean veg 2. 400g can chopped tomatoes, 1 tbsp small capers, 2 tbsp raisins, 350g rigatoni pasta 3. bunch basil leaves and parmesan
Recipe:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan and cook the onion for 8-10 mins, Add the garlic for the final 2 mins of cooking time. 2. Tip in the mixed veg, tomatoes, capers and raisins. 10 mins. Meanwhile, boil the kettle. 3. Pour the kettleful of water into a large pan with a little salt and bring back to the boil. Add the pasta and cook until tender 4. Tip the pasta into the sauce, Scatter with the basil leaves and parmesan. Serve

Ingredients:
1. 250g leek, 85g mascarpone, 1 tbsp chopped dill , plus 1 tsp. 2 skinless salmon fillets 2. ½ lemon , grated zest of 1/4, plus a good squeeze of juice, 2-3 tsp capers, baby potatoes and wilted spinach, to serve (optional)
Recipe:
1. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6. Place two sheets of baking parchment (large enough to wrap up each salmon fillet) on your work surface. 2. Put the leeks in a pan with 6 tbsp water, cover and bring to the boil. Cook for 5 mins until the water has been absorbed and the leeks are almost tender. Stir in the mascarpone, 1 tbsp dill and some seasoning. 3. Spoon half the creamy leeks into the middle of one sheet of parchment and place a salmon fillet on top, then repeat to make a second parcel. Sprinkle over the lemon zest with a squeeze of juice, then scatter over the capers and the remaining 1 tsp dill. 4. Bring the parchment up over the fish and join the two edges together by folding them over several times down the middle. Do the same with the ends and place the parcels, spaced apart, on a baking sheet. 5. Bake for 12-15 mins, depending on how well done you like your fish, then carefully tear open the parcel. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over, baby potatoes and wilted spinach, if you like.

Ingredients:
1. 1 ½ tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp low-salt soy sauce, thumb-sized piece ginger, 1 garlic clove, 1 tsp honey 2. 2 sweet potatoes, scrubbed and cut into wedges, 1 lime, 2 boneless skinless salmon fillets, 250g purple sprouting broccoli, 1 tbsp sesame seeds, 1 red chilli
Recipe:
1. Heat oven to 200C/180 fan/ gas 6 and line a baking tray with parchment. Mix together 1/2 tbsp sesame oil, the soy, ginger, garlic and honey. Put the sweet potato wedges, skin and all, into a glass bowl with the lime wedges. Cover with cling film and microwave on high for 12-14 mins until completely soft. 2. Meanwhile, spread the broccoli and salmon out on the baking tray. Spoon over the marinade and season. Roast in the oven for 10-12 mins, then sprinkle over the sesame seeds. 3. Remove the lime wedges and roughly mash the sweet potato using a fork. Mix in the remaining sesame oil, the chilli and some seasoning. Divide between plates, along with the salmon and broccoli.

Ingredients:
1. 1 large cauliflower, stems chopped. 4 tbsp olive oil, 1 diced onion, 3 tbsp red Thai curry paste 2. ½ tsp lemon zest, 1 ½ cups vegetable broth, 1 can light coconut milk, ½ tsp sugar, 3 tsp rice vinegar 3. Freshly ground black pepper, ¼ cup chopped green onions, 1 tbsp chopped fresh basil & Thinly sliced jalapeño
Recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 200c, Toss the cauliflower with enough oil to lightly coat it. 2. Spread the cauliflower on a large baking sheet and roast until the tips of the cauliflower are golden brown, about 25 to 30 minutes. 3. In a Dutch oven - medium heat, warm 1 tbsp of the oil until shimmering. Add the onion and a dash of salt , stirring occasionally. 4. Add the curry paste and lemon zest and stir to incorporate.Add all of the roasted cauliflower stems and half of the florets to the pot. Add the vegetable broth, coconut milk and sugar. 5. After 10 mins, remove the pot from heat and let soup cool, then carefully use an immersion blender to blend until smooth, stir in 1 tsp vinegar and serve !
